0.title: 800 WhiteHat Jr employees resign after being asked to return to office: Report
0.article_body: More than 800 employees of kids online coding learning startup WhiteHat Jr, which was acquired by BYJU'S, have resigned in the last 60 days after they were asked to return to their offices, Inc42 reported. WhiteHat Jr's full-time employees from various teams across the company resigned. They were asked to report to their respective offices in a month's time.

1.title: Shopkeeper held for stalking 20-yr-old former employee in Ludhiana
1.article_body: Police on Tuesday arrested a shopkeeper in Ludhiana for stalking his former employee and sending her lewd messages. According to the 20-year-old woman's father, the shopkeeper used to harass her following which she quit the job. "But after she quit...he started sending her lewd messages. When his repeated calls to her went unanswered, he reached our house," her father stated.

2.title: Musk says Tesla is open to buying a mining firm in push for clean energy
2.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Tesla is open to buying a mining company in a push for the worldwide adoption of clean energy technologies. "It's not out of the question. We will address whatever limitations are on accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy. It's not that we wish to buy mining companies," he added.

3.title: Man killed, his 3-yr-old son injured in celebratory firing in UP, 2 held
3.article_body: Two men were arrested in UP’s Muzaffarnagar after a 35-year-old man was killed and his three-year-old son was injured in a celebratory firing during a wedding, police said on Tuesday. The incident occurred late on Monday night. "Two wedding guests have been arrested. They were found involved in celebratory firing," Station House Officer (SHO), Vinod Kumar, said.

4.title: Split verdict by Delhi HC on criminalising marital rape, matter referred to SC
4.article_body: After hearing petitions challenging the exception to Section 375 of IPC, which exempts forced sexual intercourse by a man with his wife, from the offence of rape, the Delhi High Court's two-judge bench arrived on a split decision. Referring the matter to Supreme Court, Justice Rajiv Shakdher held the exception unconstitutional while Justice C Hari Shankar said it wasn't unconstitutional.

5.title: They can't feel what I feel, they can't live my life: Virat Kohli on critics amid poor form
5.article_body: Talking about critics questioning him over his poor form, RCB batter Virat Kohli, in an interaction with Danish Sait, said, "They can't be in my shoes. They can't feel what I feel." He added, "They can't live my life. They can't live those moments." Kohli further said that he doesn't pay attention to the "outside noise".

6.title: I feel insulted: Bengali writer returns award as Mamata Banerjee gets literary honour
6.article_body: Bengali writer Ratna Rashid Banerjee has returned the 'Annada Shankar Smarak Samman' given to her by the Paschimbanga Bangla Academy over its decision to confer a special award on West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. "I feel insulted. The statement of the Academy praising the relentless literary pursuit of the honourable Chief Minister is a travesty of truth," Banerjee said.

7.title: 'Disgusted' with actors in India: 'Raajneeti' director Prakash Jha
7.article_body: Director Prakash Jha who helmed 'Raajneeti' starring Ranbir Kapoor and Katrina Kaif, said he is "disgusted" with actors working in India. "They don't know what acting is about," added Jha. Discussing his web series 'Aashram', Jha stated, "'Aashram' has 1.6 billion views which is probably the most viewed web series in the world. It is double the size of IPL."

8.title: Man rapes 14-yr-old girl in Delhi, buries dead infant after abortion; held
8.article_body: Police have arrested a 23-year-old man, Dharamender alias Raj, for raping and impregnating a 14-year-old girl in Delhi after befriending her. Police said that Raj told victim to not disclose pregnancy to anyone and took her to an alleged female doctor who gave her abortion pills. The victim delivered a dead infant next day. The infant was buried by accused.

9.title: Stablecoin UST, that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, crashes to 40 cents
9.article_body: TerraUSD or 'UST', a stablecoin that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, plunged over 55% on Wednesday from 24 hours earlier to around 40 cents. Its sister token fell more than 80% to $5 and other cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ether also plunged. A stablecoin is a digital currency pegged to a "stable" reserve asset like the US dollar.

10.title: Insecticide & plastic ingredients found inside pregnant women: Study
10.article_body: Dozens of chemicals used to make plastics and those found in insecticides were found in several pregnant women during a study that analysed 171 pregnant women in the US. Scientists looked for 89 different chemicals in participants and found 73 of them in at least one person. Moreover, 36 of these substances were found in over 50% of the participants.

11.title: Maha court sentences man to life imprisonment for raping 8-yr-old girl
11.article_body: A court in Maharashtra sentenced a man to life imprisonment for raping an eight-year-old girl. The incident occurred in 2017 when the accused allegedly took the girl to an isolated place and raped her. The girl's parents later found her bleeding in the custody of the accused. The incident took place in Sativali area of Palghar.

12.title: Allah made him for me, his caste never mattered: Hyd murder victim's wife
12.article_body: Syed Ashrin Sultana, wife of Dalit man Billipuram Nagaraju, who was killed by Sultana's brother in Hyderabad said his caste never mattered to her. "I never even used to look at him as Hindu. I only thought he was made for me...that Allah made him for me," she added. Sultana said she never thought her brother would kill her husband.

13.title: Aayush Sharma pens note after death of his grandfather and ex-minister Pandit Sukh Ram
13.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma penned a note after the death of his grandfather and former Union minister Pandit Sukh Ram. "Even though you're gone, I know you'll always be with me, guiding me, looking over me and blessing me like you always do. Rest in peace dadaji, you will be dearly missed," the actor wrote.

14.title: BP Care Juice reduced high BP of 91% of users in 3 months: Kapiva
14.article_body: Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda claims 91% of its consumers observed a drop in high blood pressure with BP Care Juice, while 69% reduced their allopathy medicine dosage. The juice contains Arjuna, Shankhpushpi, Guggul, and 7+ herbs, which lowers blood pressure, improves blood circulation, reduces bad cholesterol, strengthens heart muscles, and reduces the risk of heart disease, Kapiva added.

15.title: Maha govt to speed up vaccination drive to combat possible 4th wave
15.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, the state government has decided to speed up the vaccination process to combat the fourth wave that may arrive by June or July. "There are people who refuse to take...vaccine...Due to them, the vaccination number...is low," Health Minister Rajesh Tope said. If cases rise, the mask mandate will also be brought back, he added.

16.title: 6-month-old girl found gagged in bushes in Punjab’s Zirakpur
16.article_body: A six-month-old baby girl was found in roadside bushes in Punjab's Zirakpur on Tuesday. The baby, who was gagged and covered with a cloth, was noticed by two motorcycle-borne youths, police said. "The infant was rushed to a hospital in Dhakoli and was found stable," Sub-Inspector Rajinder Singh, Zirakpur police station, said.

17.title: 3 people injured in separate leopard attacks in Pune district
17.article_body: Three people were injured in three separate incidents of leopard attacks in Khed and Ambegaon talukas of Pune district on Tuesday night and Wednesday early morning. Of those injured, two are women and one of them is critical. The two places of attack are located around one-and-half-kilometre away from each other. Forest rangers have stepped up vigil in these areas.

18.title: Felt like I've seen everything now: Kohli on smiling after 2nd golden duck in IPL 2022
18.article_body: Virat Kohli, in a video shared by RCB, said he felt helpless after he recorded his second golden duck in IPL 2022. "It hasn't happened to me ever in my career...That's why I smiled because I felt like I've seen everything now. It has been so long that I have seen everything this game has to show me," Kohli added.

19.title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.6 strikes Pithoragarh in Uttarakhand
19.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 4.6 on the Richter scale hit Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh on Wednesday morning. According to the National Center for Seismology (NCS), the quake struck at around 10 am, at a depth of five kilometres. The tremors were felt about 20 km northeast of Pithoragarh, NCS tweeted. According to reports, there was no loss of life or property.

20.title: Passenger with no flying experience lands plane in US after pilot falls unconscious
20.article_body: A passenger with no flying experience safely landed a 14-seater Cessna 208 Caravan plane at a Florida airport after the pilot fell unconscious. The passenger contacted air traffic controllers and was heard saying, "I've got a serious situation here...My pilot has gone incoherent. I've no idea how to fly the airplane." The controllers located the plane and guided the passenger.

21.title: 43,489 students miss Class 10 board exams in Odisha, govt orders probe
21.article_body: As many as 43,489 students missed their Class 10 board exams in Odisha that ended on May 7. Odisha government has ordered a probe after it was found out that 5.71 lakh students had filled up forms for exams and only 5.3 lakh appeared. Officials have been directed to conduct a school-wise analysis and submit a report within 10 days.

22.title: ASI expresses concern after J&K LG Manoj Sinha prays at protected Sun Temple: Report
22.article_body: The Archaeological Survey of India has "expressed concern to the administration" after Jammu & Kashmir Lieutenant-Governor Manoj Sinha participated in prayers at the ruins of protected eighth-century Martand Sun Temple, The Indian Express reported. The agency reportedly said no permission was sought to conduct the ceremony and asked the administration to ensure such violations are not repeated.

23.title: Teen couple found hanging from tree in Rajasthan village
23.article_body: A 19-year-old man and an 18-year-old woman, reported to be lovers, allegedly hanged themselves to death from a tree in a village in Rajasthan's Jhalawar district. They also consumed poison, a bottle of which was found nearby, according to police. No suicide note was found at the site, added police. The couple had gone missing on Monday night.

24.title: Al Jazeera female journalist shot in the face by Israeli forces: Qatar minister
24.article_body: Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh was shot dead by Israeli troops on Wednesday as she covered a raid on Jenin refugee camp in the occupied West Bank, the network said. Qatar's Assistant Foreign Minister Lolwah Al-Khater said that Akleh was shot "in the face". Al Jazeera added that the 51-year-old was shot "deliberately" by Israeli troops.

25.title: Arjun's very controversial but doesn't get bad press like I do: Kangana
25.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said actor Arjun Rampal is "very controversial" but doesn't get bad press like she does. "He says what he says, does what he does," added Kangana. "A guy can get away with anything," stated Kangana. Arjun and Kangana will star together in the upcoming film 'Dhaakad' which is a spy thriller scheduled to release on May 20.

26.title: Uttarakhand govt increases daily cap on pilgrims to Char Dham
26.article_body: The Uttarakhand government has decided to increase the daily number of pilgrims by 1,000 each to Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath and Badrinath, CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said. With this, 13,000 devotees can have 'darshan' at the Kedarnath Dham while 16,000 pilgrims can visit Badrinath in a day. As many as 5,000 and 8,000 devotees can visit Yamunotri and Gangotri respectively.

27.title: Google to pay over 300 news publishers in EU, more to follow
27.article_body: Google has agreed to pay over 300 publishers across the EU for their news and will roll out a tool for others to sign up too. However, Google has not revealed how much publishers will be paid. The EU had earlier adopted the copyright rules that require Google and other online platforms to pay news publishers for using their work.

28.title: Several offices at Vishveshwarya Bhawan in Patna gutted in fire; no casualties
28.article_body: Several offices were destroyed after a major fire broke out at the Vishveshwarya Bhawan (also called the technical secretariat) on the Jawahar Lal Nehru Marg in Bihar's Patna around 7:30 am on Wednesday. The preliminary cause of the fire is said to be a short circuit. Some labourers trapped inside the building were rescued timely. No casualty was reported.

29.title: Apologise to North Indians or go back: BJP MP ahead of MNS chief's Ayodhya visit
29.article_body: Ahead of MNS chief Raj Thackeray’s visit to Ayodhya on June 5, BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh has demanded a public apology from him for calling North Indians "criminals" in the past. "Raj Thackeray, who called North Indians criminals, should either apologise or go back," read the posters circulated by the BJP MP.

30.title: Rahul seeks permanent relief from court appearance in defamation case
30.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has sought permanent exemption from appearing before a court in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi in a defamation case. He has been accused of defaming the RSS by holding it responsible for the killing of Mahatma Gandhi. In his application, Gandhi said being an MP, he has to visit his constituency and travel a lot for party work.

31.title: Man molests 18-year-old girl at housing society swimming pool in Pune
31.article_body: An 18-year-old girl was allegedly molested by a 47-year-old man at a housing society swimming pool in Pune. The victim said that the accused had also passed lewd remarks and told her, "If you are dressed like this, you are bound to get attraction." The victim's mother has lodged a complaint with the Kondhwa Police against the accused.

32.title: Disabled UPI payments because of informal pressure from RBI: Coinbase CEO
32.article_body: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong has said that the cryptocurrency exchange suspended its UPI payment method due to informal pressure from Reserve Bank of India (RBI). "India's Supreme Court has ruled that they can't ban crypto, but there are elements in the government there, including RBI, who don't seem to be as positive on it," he further said.

33.title: Elon Musk's tweets on taking Tesla private were reckless: US judge
33.article_body: A US judge said in an April judgement that Tesla CEO Elon Musk's 2018 tweets on taking Tesla private were inaccurate and reckless, adding "there was nothing concrete" about financing from Saudi Arabia's PIF. "Rather, discussions between Tesla and the PIF were clearly at the preliminary stage," the judge added. Musk has insisted that tweets were entirely truthful.

34.title: Man assaults 26-year-old DU student over speaking in English
34.article_body: A 26-year-old Delhi University student was allegedly assaulted by a man after a fight over speaking in English. The incident occurred at a grocery store in Malviya Nagar. According to the FIR, the men got into an argument and the victim, identified as Anshuman Thapa, allegedly pushed the accused, who then ordered his pitbull to attack Thapa.

35.title: Pits for bodies dug before couple came from US: Report on Chennai double murder
35.article_body: The accused who killed the Chennai couple who had returned from the United States had already dug pits for their bodies before they arrived in India, reports said, adding, police found pair of gloves and burnt cell phone on ground where the two were buried. "When we saw this, we confirmed that definitely a murder has been committed," Police said.

36.title: Some current Hindi films very boring, painful: 'LOC...' actor Himanshu
36.article_body: Actor-turned-director Himanshu Malik who starred in the war film 'LOC: Kargil' said he finds some of the current Bollywood films "very boring" and "painful". "The world is one big marketplace. That puts a lot of pressure on traditional filmmakers," added Himanshu. "Once you go behind the camera...you can enjoy eating everything without worrying about gaining weight," stated Himanshu.

37.title: Stop partisan politics, treat everyone equally: WB Guv urges state govt
37.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday met victims of post-poll violence and asked the state government to stop "partisan politics". While comparing the victims of Birbhum's Bogtui village, where eight people were burnt alive, Dhankhar said that if they can get compensation, then those affected by post-poll violence should receive it too. "Everybody should be treated equally," he added.

38.title: Man who set woman on fire 2 days before her wedding in Gurugram held
38.article_body: A 22-year-old man, who allegedly set a 24-year-old woman on fire two days before her wedding in Gurugram, has been arrested, police said. "The man said he couldn't see her getting married to someone else so he tried to kill her," the police added. The man poured petrol on her when she refused to call off the wedding, police stated.

39.title: India denies sending troops to Sri Lanka, says 'fully supportive of its democracy'
39.article_body: The Indian High Commission on Wednesday categorically denied "speculative" reports about India sending troops to Sri Lanka. It said, "These reports and such views are not in keeping with the position of the Government of India." It added, "The Spokesperson of Ministry of External Affairs clearly stated that India is fully supportive of Sri Lanka's democracy, stability and economic recovery."

40.title: 13 boys aged between 13 and 15 harass 2 female tourists in Egypt; arrested
40.article_body: Thirteen boys aged between 13 and 15 have been arrested after being accused of harassing two female tourists at Egypt's Giza Pyramids. In a video of the incident, one of the female tourists can be seen attempting to push one of the boys away from her. The boys said they were trying to take photos with the women.

41.title: 8 charged for selling Pakistani MBBS seats in J&K, using money for terrorism
41.article_body: A Srinagar court has charged eight people, including a Hurriyat leader, for selling Pakistani MBBS seats in Jammu and Kashmir. The accused, in association with educational consultancies, were allegedly arranging admissions of J&K residents in MBBS and other courses in Pakistani colleges and universities. The money thus earned from the parents of the students was used in supporting terrorism.

42.title: MP policeman kills 6-yr-old for demanding money, dumps body in Gwalior
42.article_body: A police head constable allegedly killed a six-year-old boy in Madhya Pradesh's Datia district for demanding money from him and dumped his body in Gwalior, an official said. The accused, who was posted in Gwalior, was arrested, police said. The policeman claimed he was suffering from depression and got irritated when the boy kept asking for money, police added.

43.title: Wife of health inspector run over by train in Ambala
43.article_body: The wife of a health inspector in Ambala was run over by a train near Jandli Fatak on Tuesday. She left home at 9 am and was hit by the train an hour later. Police informed her family using a phone number they found in her wallet. Her husband said she had not been keeping well lately and was stressed.

44.title: Sri Lanka Prez warns of racial & religious tensions amid riots
44.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa urged people to reject attempts to foment "racial and religious disharmony" as violent clashes broke out in many parts of the country over the government's handling of the economic crisis. "This is the time for all Sri Lankans to join hands as one," Rajapaksa added. At least eight people have been killed in the clashes.

45.title: Don't say comedy is in danger due to me: Munawar on Sunil Pal's vulgarity remark
45.article_body: After comedian Sunil Pal asked comedian Munawar Faruqui to save comedy from vulgarity, the latter said he respects comedy as much as Sunil does. "Please don't say that comedy is in danger because of me...We all can save comedy together. Your way is different...You said I don't have 'aukaat' (worth), I'll make my worth," he added.

46.title: Thane man held for spiking drinks of female friends, sexually assaulting them
46.article_body: Thane police arrested a 33-year-old man for allegedly spiking the drinks of women and sexually assaulting them. He was arrested following a complaint by a 23-year-old woman. The accused usually befriended women and asked them out on pretext of celebrating their birthday or any similar occasion, police said. He would then spike their drinks and assault them sexually, police added.

47.title: Supreme Court puts sedition law on hold
47.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday put the sedition law on hold and urged Centre and states to refrain from registering any FIRs invoking Section 124A of IPC. The court allowed the Centre to re-examine and reconsider the provisions of Section 124A and said that no case will be registered under the section till the exercise of re-examination is complete.

48.title: Kuldeep Yadav is too slow in the air, always a gamble for DC: Manjrekar
48.article_body: Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav is a bit "too slow" in the air which always makes him a gamble for DC. "If Kuldeep works on his fitness and flight and overcomes his natural weakness, he will be more effective," added Manjrekar. Kuldeep has picked 18 wickets in 11 IPL 2022 matches so far.

49.title: SP-rank officer may be asked to monitor registration of sedition FIRs: Centre to SC
49.article_body: The Centre has told the Supreme Court that a Superintendent of Police-rank officer can be made responsible for monitoring registration of FIRs for the offence of sedition. The government added that staying provisions of sedition may not be the "correct approach". With regard to pending cases, the Centre suggested that hearing on bail pleas in such matters may be expedited.

50.title: I saw 'RRR', it blew my brains; loved 'KGF 1' and 'Pushpa': Ranveer
50.article_body: Speaking about films like 'RRR', 'Pushpa: The Rise' and 'KGF: Chapter 1', actor Ranveer Singh said, "'RRR' blew my brains. I loved 'Pushpa: The Rise' and 'KGF: Chapter 1'. I am dying to see 'KGF: Chapter 2'." "I am a huge fan of Allu Arjun, Yash," added Ranveer. "[The] technical aspects of these films are impressive," stated Ranveer.

51.title: What is tomato flu, reported in over 80 children in Kerala?
51.article_body: Tomato flu has been detected in over 80 children aged below five in Kerala. Tomato flu is an unidentified fever that causes rashes and blisters which are generally red in colour. Symptoms of the disease include skin irritation, body aches and high fever. Infected children can also have joint swellings, tiredness, cramps in the stomach, nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea.

52.title: Pakistani rupee falls to all-time low against US dollar
52.article_body: The Pakistani rupee fell to an all-time low against US dollar on Tuesday in the interbank market. Its value surged by 82 paisa in early trade and is currently trading at PKR 188.35 in the interbank market. Meanwhile, State Bank of Pakistan's foreign exchange reserves fell by $328 million to $10.558 billion during the week that ended on April 23.

53.title: Gold coloured chariot washes ashore in Andhra amid cyclone Asani; video goes viral
53.article_body: A video showing a gold coloured chariot washing ashore in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam district amid cyclone Asani has gone viral on social media. The chariot is suspected to have washed away from a faraway Southeast Asian country due to the impact of the cyclone, local residents said. People from neighbouring areas rushed to Srikakulam to see it.

54.title: Urdu teacher jailed for life for raping 6-yr-old girl in Rajasthan
54.article_body: An Urdu teacher has been sentenced to life imprisonment for raping a six-year-old girl at a madrassa in Rajasthan's Kota. The court also imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on the 43-year-old convict, Abdul Rahim. According to the prosecutor, the man raped the victim when she was alone with him after other students left the class.

55.title: Putin likely to impose martial law in Russia to support war effort: US
55.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin will "likely" impose martial law in Russia to support the war in Ukraine, Director of US National Intelligence, Avril Haines, said. Putin may also order more industrial production to make up for lost resources in the war or order "potentially escalatory military actions to free up...resources needed to achieve his objectives" in Ukraine, Haines added.

56.title: 26-year-old DU student attacked by dog over speaking in English
56.article_body: A 26-year-old Delhi University student was allegedly assaulted by a man and attacked by his dog over speaking in English. The incident occurred at a grocery store in Malviya Nagar. According to the FIR, the men got into an argument and the victim, identified as Anshuman Thapa, allegedly pushed the accused, who then ordered his pitbull to attack Thapa.

57.title: Nehru couldn’t lie in court: Mahua on govt’s remark on sedition law
57.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra reacted to Solicitor General Tushar Mehta’s statement made on Tuesday in the Supreme Court regarding the sedition law. "What Pandit Nehru couldn't do, the current government is doing, says SG Tushar Mehta. You are right, sir. Nehru couldn't lie in court, spy on countrymen, arrest innocents, lock-up dissenters with no due process," Moitra tweeted.

58.title: Deplatforming is a big deal: IT minister Chandrasekhar to Musk on Trump's Twitter ban
58.article_body: Union Minister of State for Electronics and Information Technology Rajeev Chandrasekhar on Wednesday tagged Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Twitter and wrote, "Deplatforming is a big deal" on a news article about former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey backing Musk's plan to reinstate former US President Donald Trump's Twitter account. Chandrasekhar also wrote, "It's a violation of fundamental rights of users."

59.title: J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik pleads guilty in 2017 terror case
59.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Mohammad Yasin Malik has pleaded guilty to all charges, including those under the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA), before a Delhi court in a case related to alleged terrorism and secessionist activities that disturbed the Valley in 2017. The court will hear the matter on May 19 and decide the quantum of sentence for Malik.

60.title: Veteran Congress leader Pandit Sukh Ram passes away at 95
60.article_body: Veteran Congress leader Pandit Sukh Ram passed away aged 95 in Delhi on Wednesday morning. He had suffered a brain stroke last week. After initial treatment at Netaji Subhash Chander Bose Zonal Hospital in Mandi, he was airlifted to Delhi and admitted to AIIMS on Saturday. He served as the Union Minister of Communications and Information Technology from 1993-96.

61.title: Kerala fire officer arrested in RSS worker's murder case
61.article_body: An officer of Kerala's fire department was arrested on Tuesday in connection with the murder of an RSS worker, SK Srinivasan, in Palakkad last month. According to police, the 31-year-old accused, identified as Jishad, has close links with the Popular Front of India (PFI) and is suspected to have helped the group that killed Srinivasan.

62.title: SC refuses to stay K'taka HC order of trial against man for raping wife
62.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday refused to stay a Karnataka High Court order that allowed the trial of a man in a marital rape case following a complaint against him by his wife. The trial had been stayed for over five years and the woman had been waiting indefinitely for the trial to commence, the wife's advocate said.

63.title: I agree with Musk on bans, Trump's ban was a business decision: Dorsey
63.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey has said that he agrees with Tesla CEO Elon Musk that there shouldn't be permanent bans on individual Twitter users. This comes after Musk said he will reverse former US President Donald Trump's permanent Twitter ban. Dorsey said Trump's ban was a "business decision" and that "it shouldn't have been".

64.title: Encroachment shouldn’t be seen through lens of religion: Delhi BJP chief
64.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said encroachment and illegal construction should not be viewed through the lens of religion. "When encroachment doesn't see religion, why should action against illegal constructions be viewed with that lens?" Gupta added. "Those who see it as an issue of specific communities being targeted are only doing so for their vote bank politics," Gupta stated.

65.title: MSRTC's first electric bus Shivai to run from Pune to Ahmednagar on June 1
65.article_body: Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC)'s first e-bus called 'Shivai' will be running from Pune to Ahmednagar from June 1. Reports said that the electric busses will be launched in a phased manner. "We have not yet got the official circular...about June 1 program, but...it is announced from head office, we have already started preparations," MSRTC Pune divisional controller said.

66.title: Felt like life's purpose was fulfilled: Akshay on being offered 'Prithviraj'
66.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said that he felt proud when Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi offered him the film 'Prithviraj'. "I felt like my life's purpose has been fulfilled...I realised he [Prithviraj] was such a great warrior. In school...there used to be just one paragraph about him...I am extremely proud to work on the film," Akshay added.

67.title: New Zealand to fully reopen international borders from July-end
67.article_body: New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern said the country will fully reopen its international borders from July 31 after a pandemic lockout of over two years. Reopening the borders would help relieve urgent skills shortages, revive tourism, and put immigration on a more secure footing, she added. "We're building on our proven plan to secure New Zealand's economic future," Ardern said.

68.title: Belarus to deploy special forces near border with Ukraine
68.article_body: The Belarusian armed forces said it will deploy special operations troops to three areas near its border with Ukraine. "The US and its allies continue to build up their military presence on the state borders of…Belarus," Chief of General Staff Viktor Gulevich said. Belarus is also deploying air defence, artillery and missile units for drills in the west, he added.

69.title: Delhi govt to develop 2 water bodies in Burari as 'safe open spaces'
69.article_body: Delhi Water Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday said two lakes in Satya Vihar and Lakshmi Vihar Extension colony in Burari will be developed as 'safe open spaces'. The minister was inspecting the development work of the two lakes which were recently revived using natural and cost-effective methods. Notably, the government is reviving 23 lakes under the 'City of Lakes' project.

70.title: Police arrest man who gave shelter to suspects in Mohali blast case
70.article_body: Police have arrested a man, Nishan Singh, who allegedly gave logistics support to suspects in the Rocket-Propelled Grenade blast that took place at Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali on Monday. Police said Singh provided shelter to two accused in Amritsar for three days before the blast. Reports said that Singh was arrested with help of inputs provided by NIA.

71.title: Mysterious fish with bulging yellow eyes caught in Russia, pic surfaces
71.article_body: A mysterious fish with bulging yellow eyes was pulled from 1,100 metres deep in Russia. Deep-sea fisherman Roman Fedortsov shared the picture of the sea creature on Instagram. "Are these actual rare species we don’t talk about or rare abnormalities due to pollution?" a user commented. "We still don’t know what is in our oceans," wrote another.

72.title: LSG mentor Gambhir's dressing room speech after loss to GT goes viral, says 'We gave up'
72.article_body: LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir's dressing room speech following their defeat against GT went viral. In the video shared by LSG, Gambhir said, "There's nothing wrong in losing. It's absolutely fine. There's a lot wrong in giving up." He added, "Today...I thought that we gave up. We were weak. Honestly, there's no place for being weak in a tournament like IPL."

73.title: Karnataka govt bans use of loudspeakers from 10 pm to 6 am
73.article_body: Amid the Azan row, the Karnataka government issued new guidelines on Tuesday and banned the use of loudspeakers from 10 pm to 6 am in the state except in closed premises like auditoriums, conference rooms, community halls and banquet halls. Those who wish to use loudspeakers must obtain written permission from the authorities within 15 days, it added.

74.title: Clear ₹122 billion dues or we'll be forced to shut down power plants: China firms to Pak
74.article_body: More than two dozen Chinese firms operating in Pakistan on Monday said that they would be forced to shut down their power plants this month if the country does not clear the ₹122 billion dues, the Dawn reported. They said the authorities were pressuring them to maximise generation to meet peak summer needs.

75.title: Starlink resisted Russian hacks, but they're ramping up efforts: Musk
75.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in response to a report on Russia attacking satellite internet in Ukraine said, "Starlink has resisted Russian cyberwar jamming and hacking attempts so far, but they're ramping up their efforts." Western nations' officials said Russia took tens of thousands of modems offline when the war started. Viasat's KA-SAT network had faced the attack in late February.

76.title: Musk jokingly agrees to hand over Twitter's control to YouTuber MrBeast if he dies
76.article_body: Elon Musk jokingly agreed to hand over control of Twitter to 24-year-old YouTuber MrBeast if he dies. Musk had tweeted, "If I die under mysterious circumstances, it's been nice knowing ya," after Roscosmos chief Dmitry Olegovich Rogozin accused the Tesla CEO of supplying "fascist forces in Ukraine". "Elon, you'll be held accountable like an adult," Rogozin said.

77.title: Woman beaten to death in Gujarat for spreading rumours; 4 booked
77.article_body: Police booked four persons for allegedly beating up a 60-year-old woman to death in Gujarat's Borsad. Her son alleged one of the accused called him while he was at work and said he had assaulted his mother as she was spreading rumours about him and his wife. When her son reached home, they also assaulted him with sticks and rods.

78.title: COVID compounded challenge of fighting global warming: Union Minister
78.article_body: The COVID-19 pandemic has "compounded the challenge" of fighting global warming as economic pressures have delayed the progress of climate action around the world, Union Minister Bhupender Yadav said on Tuesday. Yadav added that India has made significant progress in its commitment to restore 26 million hectares of degraded land by 2030.

79.title: India reports 2,897 COVID-19 cases, 54 deaths in 24 hours
79.article_body: India has reported 2,897 COVID-19 cases, 2,986 recoveries and 54 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,288 COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,494, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,157.

80.title: MP minister Inder Singh Parmar's 22-yr-old daughter-in-law found hanging
80.article_body: Madhya Pradesh School Education Minister Inder Singh Parmar's 22-year-old daughter-in-law, Savita Parmar, was found hanging at their residence in Shajapur on Tuesday, ANI reported. Her body was sent for a post-mortem on Wednesday morning. The cause of the incident is said to be a "family problem" although police are yet to confirm the same, as per a report.

81.title: Ugandan woman smuggles drugs in intestine, remanded in Chennai
81.article_body: A Ugandan woman, who was found smuggling drugs in the form of capsules in her stomach, was sent to 14-day judicial custody on Tuesday. The 33-year-old accused was arrested at Chennai International Airport on May 6 after officials scanned her and found several capsules in her intestine. Forty capsules containing drugs were removed from her stomach at government hospital.

82.title: 89% of children between 6-23 months do not get 'minimum acceptable diet': NFHS
82.article_body: According to the National Family Health Survey (NFHS-5), 89% of children between the ages of 6-23 months do not get a "minimum acceptable diet". Among all states and UTs, the proportion of children aged 6-23 months who received adequate diet was highest in Meghalaya at 28.5%, while it was the lowest at 5.9% each in UP and Gujarat.

83.title: Shubman Gill reacts to getting trolled for 'slow knock', shares tortoise and hare emoji
83.article_body: GT's Shubman Gill took to Twitter to react to a news article about him getting trolled for his "slow knock" in his team's victory against LSG. He posted an emoji of a tortoise and a hare, seemingly referring to the fable, where the tortoise beats the hare in a race. Gill was named Player of the Match for scoring 63*(49).

84.title: China's zero-COVID policy not sustainable: WHO chief
84.article_body: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Tuesday said that China's zero-tolerance COVID-19 policy is not sustainable considering the behaviour of the virus. WHO emergencies director Mike Ryan said the impact of a "zero-COVID" policy on human rights also needs to be taken into consideration alongside the effect on a country's economy from any COVID policy.

85.title: 4 Russian Governors resign amid worsening economy
85.article_body: Four Russian Governors resigned amid a declining economic trend owing to the sanctions imposed by the West over the Ukraine war. The heads of Tomsk, Saratov, Kirov and Mari El regions resigned, while the Governor of Ryazan region said he would not seek another term. "Kremlin was removing weak Governors amid a worsening economic outlook," said a Moscow-based think tank.

86.title: ABVP protests against Dalit prof in UP over remark on Kashi temple
86.article_body: ABVP staged a protest against Lucknow University's Associate Professor Ravi Kant, a Dalit, over "objectionable" comments on Varanasi's Kashi Vishwanath temple. The student body campus chief said that Kant expressed regret over his remark but later posted on social media that ABVP wanted to lynch him. Meanwhile, Kant said the comments were not his personal opinion but a book reference.

87.title: I would steal a lot of things: Azma Fallah on 'Lock Upp'
87.article_body: Azma Fallah who was recently seen in the first season of reality show 'Lock Upp' said she would "steal" a lot of things while participating in the show, adding she would hide things someone became obsessed with. "I did not have the strength to fight back but I could attack them through these actions," stated Azma.

88.title: Naseeruddin said 'You play the fool and the fool's the wisest': Ranveer
88.article_body: Sharing an interaction with actor Naseeruddin Shah, Ranveer Singh said, "Naseer sir told me, 'You choose to play the fool and the fool is actually the wisest one'. I am happy to be the court jester." "My wife [Deepika Padukone] keeps telling me that you are so intelligent but we don't often get to see that side," added Ranveer.

89.title: Will stay at Tesla as long as I can be useful: Elon Musk
89.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on being asked about how long he expects to stay at Tesla, said, "As long as I can be useful." Musk, who is in talks to buy Twitter, is expected to become the platform's temporary CEO. Earlier in July 2021, Musk had said he has tried "very hard not to be the CEO of Tesla".

90.title: AAP protests against 'poor' construction work at Vajpayee Stadium in B'luru
90.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) held a protest in Bengaluru on Tuesday against "poor" construction work at Atal Bihari Vajpayee Stadium. "The gallery roof [at the stadium] has collapsed barely two months after getting inaugurated by CM Basavaraj Bommai. This is an example of...40% commission corruption of...BJP government and local MLA Satish Reddy," Bengaluru AAP President Mohan Dasari said.

91.title: EA and FIFA to end partnership, FIFA game to be called EA Sports FC from 2023
91.article_body: Electronic Arts (EA) and FIFA have announced that they are ending their decades-long partnership. FIFA said it'd launch new football video games developed by third-party studios and publishers, but added it has granted a new short-term extension to EA Sports to launch 'FIFA 23' this year. EA said that it'll rebrand EA Sports FIFA as EA Sports FC from 2023.

92.title: Sri Lanka Army denies reports claiming armed forces ordered to shoot at protestors
92.article_body: Sri Lankan Chief of Defence Staff and Commander of the Army, General Shavendra Silva, on Tuesday denied reports claiming that the armed forces have been ordered to open fire at anyone looting public property or causing harm to others. Silva added that the members of the armed forces would not resort to any such disgraceful acts under any circumstances.

93.title: Over 80,000 devotees visit Kedarnath Dham on 5th day of opening of shrine
93.article_body: More than 80,000 pilgrims visited Kedarnath Dham on the fifth day of the opening of the shrine on Tuesday. "From the helipad located in Kedarnath Dham to the temple, there is a long queue of devotees to have darshan," Ayush Agrawal, SP, Rudraprayag, said. "Six devotees who came to Kedarnath pilgrimage have died due to deteriorating health," he added.

94.title: Andhra Pradesh intermediate exams on May 11 postponed to May 25 due to Cyclone Asani
94.article_body: Andhra Pradesh's Board of Intermediate Education has postponed exams scheduled for May 11 to May 25. "Rest of the examination schedule from May 12 remains unchanged...examination centre venues and the timings are unchanged," it added. This comes after the India Meteorological Department issued a red warning for Andhra Pradesh, as severe cyclonic storm Asani has changed its track.

95.title: Internet suspended in Raj's Bhilwara after 22-yr-old stabbed to death
95.article_body: A 22-year-old man was stabbed to death in Kotwali Police Station area of Rajasthan's Bhilwara on Tuesday. Following the incident, police forces have been deployed in the area. "Internet services in Bhilwara to remain suspended till 6 am on Thursday, 12th May," Bhilwara District Collector, Ashish Modi, said. Reports said that the man was killed following a monetary dispute.

96.title: Woman acquitted of slapping female police constable at Mumbai pub
96.article_body: A sessions court recently acquitted a 44-year-old woman for allegedly slapping a female police constable at a pub in Mumbai. The incident occurred on New Year's Eve in 2011 during a scuffle over the closing time of the pub. The court acquitted the woman after finding that she had accidentally touched the constable's cheek in an attempt to rescue herself.

97.title: Supertech asks SC for time till August 28 to demolish Noida twin towers
97.article_body: Supertech asked Supreme Court for an extension of the deadline to demolish the Noida twin towers till August 28, which were scheduled to be demolished on May 22. Edifice Engineering needs more time to ensure there is no mishap during the blast, officials said. "The only reason we need extension is to ensure...job is done with...safety," an official added.

98.title: Bengaluru reports 121 new COVID-19 cases; active cases at 1,802
98.article_body: Bengaluru reported 121 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, taking the number of active cases in the city to 1,802. In the last 24 hours, Bengaluru has reported zero coronavirus-related deaths and 124 new recoveries, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). The positivity rate in the city now stands at 1.09%, data showed.

99.title: Death registrations in several states fell in pandemic year: Data
99.article_body: Despite the onset of COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, the number of deaths registered in several states including Telangana, Uttar Pradesh, Kerala, Uttarakhand and UT of Delhi saw a decline, according to Civil Registration System data. UP recorded 8.73 lakh deaths in 2020, down from 9.44 lakh in 2019. In the same year, the overall death registrations in the country increased.

100.title: We're trying to do what Pandit Nehru couldn't do then: Centre to SC on sedition law
100.article_body: Senior Advocate Kapil Sibal who was representing petitioners challenging the sedition law in Supreme Court on Tuesday said, "We're in post-constitution era. Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru had said this provision is obnoxious and the sooner we get rid of sedition, the better." Representing the Centre, Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, said, "We're trying to do what Pandit Nehru could not do then."

101.title: South director said 'where has she come from', I cried after coming home: Nikki
101.article_body: Actress Nikki Tamboli said that director of a South movie ill treated her. "He was not treating me right on the set...He was literally saying, 'Where has she come from?'" Nikki said, adding, "He was the worst I should say...I have even cried after coming home...I was so tortured by that director, that I would come home and cry."

102.title: Ford sells its shares in Tesla-rival Rivian for $214 million
102.article_body: Ford Motor has sold 8 million shares of Tesla-rival Rivian for $214 million, or $26.80 apiece, the automaker revealed in a filing. It now holds 93.9 million shares in the electric vehicle maker. Shares of Rivian fell nearly 21% on Monday following a CNBC report that revealed the sale of 8 million shares by Ford Motor.

103.title: Hyderabad Police busts illegal inter-state transporting of ganja, 1 held
103.article_body: Hyderabad's Nacharam Police, along with the sleuths of the Special Operations Team, busted an illegal inter-state transporting of contraband ganja. The drug was being transported from Sileru on the Andra Pradesh-Odisha border to Narayankhed of Sangareddy, police added. One person was arrested and 22 kilograms of ganja and one bike were seized from his possession, police further said.

104.title: Independent Ukraine's 1st President Leonid Kravchuk dies aged 88
104.article_body: Leonid Kravchuk, who served as the first President of independent Ukraine, died on Tuesday at the age of 88. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy described Kravchuk as a wise leader who guided the country in the chaotic first years of independence from Soviet rule. "He was a person always able to find wise words," Zelenskyy said.

105.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as GT qualify for playoffs?
105.article_body: With their win against LSG, GT moved to the top of the IPL 2022 points table with 18 points and qualified for the playoffs. LSG are placed second on the table with 16 points and a net run-rate (NRR) of 0.385. RR and RCB have 14 points each, while DC, SRH, KKR and PBKS have 10 points each.

106.title: I was 117 kg during my U-19 days: CSK's 21-year-old spinner Theekshana
106.article_body: CSK's 21-year-old spinner Maheesh Theekshana has revealed he was 117 kg during his Under-19 days. "I had to work harder to get my weight and skin folds down in the yo-yo test. In 2020, I got everything down and brought my fitness to the required level," he added. "I never thought CSK would bid for me this year," he stated.

107.title: I will reverse the 'flat-out stupid' Twitter ban on Donald Trump: Elon Musk
107.article_body: Elon Musk on Tuesday said that he will reverse Twitter's ban on former US President Donald Trump, adding that the ban was "morally wrong and flat-out stupid". Musk further said that the ban amplified Trump's views among people on the political right. Musk recently inked a $44 billion deal to acquire the social media platform.

108.title: Mumbai man held for wife's murder as police find blood stains on his nails
108.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a 22-year-old man for his wife's murder after they found blood stains on his nails. The man, Manoj Prajapati, and his wife, Reema Yadav, were staying separately for few days. Reema's friend later found her lying in pool of blood. Police said Reema's throat was slit. Manoj was questioned after blood stains were found on his nails.

109.title: Bill Gates tests positive for COVID-19
109.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates took to Twitter on Tuesday and wrote, "I've tested positive for COVID-19. I'm experiencing mild symptoms and am following the experts' advice by isolating until I'm healthy again." "I'm fortunate to be vaccinated and boosted and have access to testing and great medical care," he added.

110.title: IPL auction is important, 50% of the job is done on auction table: Gambhir
110.article_body: Stressing on the importance of IPL mega auction, LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir said, "50% of the job is done on the auction table. It helps the management when you pick a good side." He added, "But as long as they don't perform on...field, it doesn't matter even if you pick the best possible players." It's LSG's maiden IPL season.

111.title: Over 50 bonded labourers rescued from a brick kiln in UP's Bhadohi
111.article_body: In a joint raid conducted by the district administration, labour department and the police department, 55 bonded labourers including children were rescued from a brick kiln in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi. Labour Enforcement Officer Pratima Maurya said that all the rescued workers hailed from Chhattisgarh. The brick kiln owners Jameel Khan and Hayat Khan fled from the spot, Maurya added.

112.title: Fake reports: Indian High Commission on rumours of SL politicians escaping to India
112.article_body: The High Commission of India in Colombo, Sri Lanka has denied reports that some Sri Lankan politicians have escaped to India amid the economic crisis in the country. "High Commission has recently noticed rumours circulating...that certain political persons and their families have fled to India. These are fake and blatantly false reports, devoid of any truth or substance," it tweeted.

113.title: Once I started to understand game bit more, was always fan of Kohli: Gill
113.article_body: On being asked about his greatest inspiration, GT opener Shubman Gill said while growing up, it was Sachin Tendulkar. "Once he retired and once I started to understand the game a bit more, I was always a fan of Virat [Kohli] bhai," he added. With 384 runs from 12 matches, Gill is currently the leading-scorer for GT in ongoing IPL.

114.title: India assisting other nations in fight against COVID-19: JP Nadda
114.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda said that India is assisting other nations in the fight against COVID-19 under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Crediting PM's leadership for the COVID-19 vaccines, he said, "We've given 18.5 crore vaccine doses to 100 countries." The Opposition is forced to seek votes based on development because of PM Modi, he added.

115.title: Father shoots son dead after a scuffle in UP's Kaushambi
115.article_body: Police said that a man shot at his son with his licensed gun after a scuffle in Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi, adding that the youth died during treatment. Reports say that the accused, Shiv Narayan, a farmer, lived with his sons Rakesh Singh and Brajesh Singh. The victim, Brajesh, received injuries to the chest and neck and collapsed, the police added.

116.title: Second hate speech case registered against ex-Kerala MLA PC George
116.article_body: A new hate speech case has been registered against ex-Kerala MLA PC George, a few days after he was arrested and released for making communal remarks. Kochi City Police Commissioner Nagaraju Chakilam said George has violated the bail conditions by making the same mistake again. He was earlier arrested on May 1 for allegedly making controversial statements against Muslims.

117.title: GIC, Tiger Global among 64 anchor investors for Delhivery IPO: Report
117.article_body: Logistics startup Delhivery's IPO, which opened for the anchor investors on Tuesday, attracted as many as 64 investors, Moneycontrol reported. These include GIC, Tiger Global Investments and Goldman Sachs Funds among others. ICICI Prudential Flexicap Fund, HDFC large and mid-cap fund and entities from SBI were reportedly also part of the list.

118.title: Female anti-Romeo squad constable raped by fellow policeman in UP
118.article_body: A female constable of the anti-Romeo squad was abused and raped by a fellow policeman in Uttar Pradesh on the pretext of marriage. The accused surrendered 70 days after the woman complained and has been sent to judicial custody. The victim had written to the Superintendent of Police complaining about the same, after which a formal case was registered.

119.title: GT beat LSG to record their biggest win, become 1st team to qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs
119.article_body: GT defeated LSG by 62 runs to record their biggest win (by runs) in IPL 2022. With the win, GT moved to the top of the points table and became the first team to qualify for the IPL 2022 playoffs. Shubman Gill top-scored for GT with 63*(49), while their vice-captain Rashid Khan recorded bowling figures of 3.5-0-24-4.

120.title: Man City confirm agreement to sign Haaland in deal reported to be worth £51.5 million
120.article_body: Manchester City have confirmed a deal to sign Erling Haaland from Borussia Dortmund this summer. The striker's buyout clause, reported to be £51.5 million, has been met by Manchester City. The Norway international will earn £375,000 per week excluding bonuses. Haaland will join the club on July 1, subject to the club finalising terms with the player.

121.title: Govt calls out Twitter for violating India's free speech laws: Bloomberg report
121.article_body: The government has called out Twitter for violating the Indian Constitution and free speech rights, Bloomberg reported. The Ministry of Information Technology objected to the suspension of lawyer Sanjay Hegde's Twitter account about three years ago in a court filing last week, it further added. It had earlier said the matter was for Twitter and Hegde to resolve.

122.title: DC captain Pant is almost at his best when he's reckless: Vettori
122.article_body: Discussing Rishabh Pant's form in ongoing IPL, ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said the DC captain is almost at his best when he's "reckless". He added, "We've seen him play some exceptional innings when he just continues to take teams downtime and time again." Pant has scored 281 runs from 11 matches so far. DC are currently fifth in standings.

123.title: $800 billion wiped off crypto market's value in a month
123.article_body: Crypto assets lost $800 billion in market value over the past month, touching a low of $1.4 trillion on Tuesday, as per data site CoinMarketCap. This comes as world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin briefly hit a 10-month low on Tuesday before rebounding to $31,450. Meanwhile, stablecoin TerraUSD lost a third of its value as it lost its peg to the dollar.

124.title: Pfizer to buy Biohaven for $11.6 bn in its biggest deal since 2016
124.article_body: Pfizer will acquire biotech group Biohaven Pharmaceuticals for $11.6 billion, marking its biggest deal since 2016. Biohaven's Rimegepant medication, used as both a treatment and preventative for migraines, is expected to bring in sales of over $4 billion by 2030. This comes as Pfizer expects sales of its COVID-19 vaccines to drop from last year's highs.

125.title: India's outward FDI drops nearly 50% y-o-y to $3.39 bn in April
125.article_body: India's outward foreign direct investment (OFDI) nearly halved to $3.39 billion in April on an annual basis, data released by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) showed. In comparison, the OFDI stood at $6.71 billion in April 2021 and $3.44 billion in March 2022. The equity component in April was $544.87 million and loans amounted to $764.25 million.

126.title: Netflix may begin crackdown on password-sharing by end of 2022: Report
126.article_body: Netflix could launch lower-priced ad-supported plans in the final three months of 2022 and begin cracking down on password-sharing during the same time, the NYT reported. It said the details were mentioned in a note to Netflix employees by the company's executives. Notably, Netflix lost subscribers for the first time in over 10 years in the first quarter of 2022.

127.title: I'd like to meet him: Musk as Twitter user shares pic of his 'Chinese lookalike'
127.article_body: After a Twitter user shared a picture of Tesla CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk's Chinese lookalike, Musk said, "I'd like to meet this guy." Musk, however, said he wasn't sure if the man was real, adding, "(It's) hard to tell with deepfakes these days." "Should we deploy Chinese Elon Musk as a decoy?" the user had asked.

128.title: Not about North or South, it's about coming up with good entertainers: Jackky
128.article_body: Actor-producer Jackky Bhagnani has said, "It's not about North or South, it's about coming up with good quality entertainers." He added, "All kinds of audiences enjoying one particular film is actually great. [The] common audience is telling us something and we must listen." This comes after films like 'RRR', 'KGF' franchise and 'Pushpa: The Rise' were commercially successful across India.

129.title: Cocaine worth $14 million found near diver's body in Australia
129.article_body: Australian police on Tuesday launched a probe after 50 kg of cocaine (worth $14 million) was found near the body of a diver at a riverbank in New South Wales state. The deceased, whose identity is yet to be ascertained, was found by authorities in an unconscious state on Monday. Investigators have searched an overseas-registered ship docked near crime scene.

130.title: 44 members of right-wing groups detained over protest to rename Qutub Minar
130.article_body: As many as 44 members of right-wing organisations, who recited Hanuman Chalisa outside Delhi's Qutub Minar and demanded the minaret be renamed 'Vishnu Stambh', were detained on Tuesday, DCP South said. The demonstrators alleged Qutub Minar was built by "great king Vikramaditya", but Qutubuddin Aibak later claimed credit for it. "Permission was not granted for the gathering," the DCP added.

131.title: CM Gehlot was celebrating birthday during Jodhpur violence: Nadda
131.article_body: BJP national president JP Nadda on Tuesday said that Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot was busy celebrating his birthday when there was violence in Jodhpur. "Every time we open a newspaper, we see a new incident happening in Rajasthan," he said. The state is on top for atrocities against women, Dalits and the state's leaders are involved in corruption, he added.

132.title: Don't test our patience: MNS chief to Maha CM on loudspeaker issue
132.article_body: Amid the loudspeaker issue in Maharashtra, MNS chief Raj Thackeray in his letter to Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray told the state government to 'not test the party's patience'. In his letter, Raj Thackeray said that over 28,000 MNS workers were served notices. He also questioned why many MNS workers were arrested even before they began protesting against loudspeakers in mosques.

133.title: TMC's Abhishek Banerjee to inaugurate party headquarters in Guwahati
133.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Abhishek Banerjee will visit Guwahati on Wednesday to inaugurate a new state headquarters and meet the TMC's state leadership. The announcement comes weeks after ex-Congress leader Ripun Bora joined TMC as head of party's Assam unit. "We're planning to fight the panchayat polls in Assam and field candidates in...Lok Sabha elections," a TMC leader said.

134.title: Akhilesh Yadav & his uncle Shivpal meet at wedding in UP, don't talk
134.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav came across his uncle Shivpal Yadav at a wedding in Lucknow but the two leaders didn't talk to each other. They were present at the wedding of the nephew of former Uttar Pradesh DGP Jagmohan Yadav. Akhilesh had last month said that Shivpal Yadav, who heads Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia, has a soft spot for BJP.

135.title: Set your priorities right: Congress to Punjab CM after Mohali blast
135.article_body: Punjab Congress president Amarinder Singh Raja on Tuesday asked Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to set his priorities right and focus on serious challenges confronting the state. The "audacious terror attack" at Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali was an attempt at exploiting the inexperience of the current government, he said. Mann had earlier said that a probe was underway.

136.title: Bulldozer badnaam hua, encroachment tere liye: Naqvi on Shaheen Bagh
136.article_body: Amid a row over the demolition drive in Shaheen Bagh, Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Tuesday said, "Bulldozer badnaam hua, encroachment tere liye". He added that it has become a fashion to give a "communal colour" to criminal acts, and asserted that "legal action" against "illegal acts" should be supported.

137.title: E-scooter fires are very rare, but they may occur in the future: Ola Electric CEO
137.article_body: Ola Electric's CEO Bhavish Aggarwal said at a private company event that incidents of electric scooters catching fire are "very rare and isolated", as per Reuters. However, he noted that there might be such occurrences in the future. Aggarwal said, "There'll be, sometimes, some minor defects in, maybe the cell, maybe something else, which will cause some internal short circuit."

138.title: Man attacks wife with an axe during a domestic dispute in Lucknow
138.article_body: Police said that a 35-year-old woman is critical after she was attacked with an axe by her husband during a domestic dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. They said that the victim, Laxmi Devi, suffered injuries on her neck, hand and waist. The accused fled the spot after the incident and efforts are on to arrest him, police added.

139.title: Apple discontinues iPod after 20 years
139.article_body: Apple on Tuesday announced that it is discontinuing the iPod touch, its last remaining music player model in the market. "iPod touch will be available while supplies last," the company said in a blog. Apple had introduced the first iPod on October 23, 2001, which had the capacity to store 1,000 songs in MP3 format and a 10-hour battery life.

140.title: Release date of 'Ek Villain 2' postponed, will now release on July 29
140.article_body: The release date of Arjun Kapoor-starrer 'Ek Villain Returns' has been postponed. Taking to Instagram, the film's director Mohit Suri wrote, "'Ek Villain Returns' gets a new release date, 29th July 2022." The film was initially slated to release on July 8. The film also stars Tara Sutaria, John Abraham, and Disha Patani.

141.title: BJP paying lip-service to people displaced from PoJK: Ex-minister
141.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Minister Ajay Kumar Sadhotra on Monday accused the BJP of delivering "lip service" to people displaced from the Pakistan-occupied J&K (PoJK). "BJP is raising false slogans besides rhetoric on every crucial issue. The way the PoJK-displaced people have been treated speaks volumes about its insensitivity towards their plight," he said.

142.title: Russia to skip UNHRC's session on Ukraine, calls it 'new political show'
142.article_body: Russia has said that it will not participate in UNHRC's special session on the Ukraine crisis, describing the upcoming event as a 'new political show'. Russia's Ministry of Foreign Affairs spokesperson Maria Zakharova further said that Moscow's explanations of its ongoing military offensive in Ukraine will be ignored "yet again". Russia was suspended from the UNHRC on April 7.

143.title: Why only Assam?: Yechury asks Shah to remove AFSPA from other states
143.article_body: CPI(M) general secretary Sitaram Yechury on Tuesday urged Union Home Minister Amit Shah to withdraw the Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA) from other Northeastern states. "Why do not you withdraw AFSPA from everywhere? Is there a political motive behind this? There will be some conspiracy to provoke communal polarisation again," he said

144.title: Never dreamt I'd come this far: Dhanush on 20 yrs in film industry
144.article_body: After completing 20 years in the film industry, actor Dhanush took to Twitter and wrote, "Time flies, never did I even dream I'd come this far when I started 'Thulluvadho Ilamai'." "I can't thank my fans enough for the continuous love...support, you are the pillars of my strength," he added. Dhanush will next be seen in 'The Gray Man'.

145.title: Spain dismisses spy chief over scandal involving Pegasus spyware
145.article_body: Spanish spy chief Paz Esteban has been dismissed over a dual phone-hacking scandal involving Pegasus spyware, Defence Minister Margarita Robles said. "Of course there are security flaws and there will continue to be," Robles said. Spain's National Intelligence Centre is also being questioned over its failure to prevent PM Pedro Sanchez and other officials' phones from being hacked using Pegasus.

146.title: IMD issues red alert for Andhra Pradesh as Cyclone Asani changes track
146.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red warning for Andhra Pradesh, as severe cyclonic storm Asani has changed its track. According to the IMD, Cyclone Asani is likely to touch the coastal belt in Andhra Pradesh between Visakhapatnam and Kakinada on Wednesday morning. The cyclone is likely to further weaken into a depression on Thursday morning.

147.title: Kejriwal thought himself above law, court proved him wrong: Bagga
147.article_body: After Punjab and Haryana High Court put a stay on his arrest till July 5, BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga said, "Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal thought he was above law, but the court proved him wrong." He further alleged that Punjab Police are tracking those who are tweeting or speaking against Kejriwal instead of focussing on their real duty.

148.title: India looking at tapping new markets for edible oil: Sitharaman
148.article_body: India is looking at tapping new markets for the import of edible oils, following the conflict between Ukraine and Russia, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday. "There are various hurdles in terms of importing oils. You know we are not able to import edible oil; we were getting sunflower oil. Now, we are not," she said.

149.title: Axis Bank awaits probe report on alleged mutual fund scam: Report
149.article_body: Axis Bank will wait for the report on an investigation into alleged front-running at Axis Mutual Fund (MF) before taking the final decision on penalising guilty officials, Moneycontrol reported. The allegations are being probed by two external agencies appointed by Axis MF. The probe was launched in February 2022, Axis MF MD and CEO Chandresh Nigam said on May 8.

150.title: 40 places raided as CBI probes NGOs over FCRA licence, MHA officials questioned
150.article_body: The CBI raided 40 locations in a nationwide crackdown on NGOs in connection to alleged Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA) violations, reports said on Tuesday. The agency is investigating alleged collusion between government officials and NGO representatives for illegal FCRA licence clearances in exchange for bribes. Six Ministry of Home Affairs officials are reportedly being questioned.

151.title: Historic Pak bridge swept away by glacial lake's water amid heatwave
151.article_body: Pakistan's historic Hassanabad bridge was swept away by a glacial lake outburst flood (GLOF) amid a persistent heatwave. Videos that surfaced on social media showed water slamming against the concrete of the bridge, leading to the collapse of the bridge. The Shishper glacier reportedly started melting due to the heatwave that led to the floods over the weekend.

152.title: BYJU'S buys Northwest Executive Education for $100 mn: Report
152.article_body: BYJU'S group company Great Learning has reportedly acquired Singapore's executive education firm Northwest Executive Education in a stock and cash deal of around $100 million. "BYJU'S is aggressively focusing on the higher education segment...Northwest Executive's acquisition will just add to it," a source told Moneycontrol. In February, Great Learning had bought out recruitment platform Superset.

153.title: 9-yr-old girl raped & murdered by a relative in MP, man arrested
153.article_body: Police said that a nine-year-old girl was allegedly raped and murdered by a distant relative, during a marriage function in Madhya Pradesh's Datia district. They said that the 24-year-old accused was arrested in the case. During interrogation, the accused confessed to the crime and said that he killed the victim to hide the crime, the police added.

154.title: LSG are peaking at the right time in IPL: Jaffer
154.article_body: Talking about table-toppers LSG, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said KL Rahul-led side are peaking at the right time in IPL 2022. He added that they won their last match against KKR with a big margin of 75 runs and every match of theirs has gone down the wire. "They've never lost any matches as a one-sided affair," he further said.

155.title: Equity investors' wealth falls over ₹11.22 lakh crore in 3 days
155.article_body: Equity investors have become poorer by over ₹11.22 lakh crore in three days following a sell-off in markets amid weak global cues. Sensex fell for the third consecutive session on Tuesday, falling 1,337.38 points or 2.4% since Friday. Foreign institutional investors remained net-sellers on Monday, offloading shares worth a net ₹3,361.80 crore.

156.title: Fight for your rights like Jignesh Mevani: Rahul to tribals in Gujarat
156.article_body: Addressing tribals in Gujarat's Dahod on Tuesday, Congress' Rahul Gandhi urged people to seek inspiration from Vadgam MLA Jignesh Mevani for his "fearless fight" against BJP. Gandhi launched 'Adivasi Adhikar Satyagraha' campaign today ahead of state's Assembly polls. Jignesh Mevani has been sentenced to three months in jail by Gujarat court for holding an 'Azadi' march in 2017 without permission.

157.title: MP man who helped people during COVID-19 booked for raping 27-yr-old
157.article_body: A 34-year-old man who helped people during the second wave of COVID-19 was booked for allegedly raping his 27-year-old tenant in Bhopal, police said on Tuesday. The woman in her complaint said that Javed Khan first raped her on March 3 while her husband was at work. He continued the act till April 25 after which the family shifted.

158.title: Chris Hemsworth is godly, he's also kind & good actor: Elizabeth Olsen
158.article_body: Elizabeth Olsen called Chris Hemsworth "godly" and added, "His arm is way bigger than my head...he's also a charming, kind and good actor." Elizabeth and her 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' co-star Benedict Cumberbatch were asked to agree or disagree if Hemsworth was the most handsome actor in the MCU, to which they both agreed.

159.title: Goal is to win one of the 3 Grand Slams that remain this year: Alcaraz
159.article_body: World number six Carlos Alcaraz said winning one of the remaining three Grand Slams of 2022 is his goal this year, adding he's hopeful to do it at upcoming French Open. "It's a great motivation for me [to win a Slam] and I'll fight for it," he added. The 19-year-old recently won his fourth title of 2022 at Madrid Open.

160.title: It's always special: Djokovic on his matches vs Nadal at Italian Open
160.article_body:
World number one Novak Djokovic said his matches against 10-time champion Rafael Nadal at Italian Open have always been special. "We've played so many years...so many matchups on this surface than any other surface," he added. Nadal and Djokovic are slated to meet in semi-finals. 
Djokovic has won only three of his nine matches against Nadal in Rome.

161.title: 25-yr-old woman patient raped by sweeper in UP hospital
161.article_body: A 25-year-old woman patient was allegedly raped by a sweeper on May 7 in UP’s Mirzapur divisional hospital when she had gone to the washroom. The woman informed her husband about the incident, following which the matter was reported to the police on Tuesday. Mirzapur ASP Sanjay Kumar said that three teams have been formed to arrest the accused.

162.title: US removes 'Taiwan is part of China' reference from State Dept site, China reacts
162.article_body: US State Department website's section on Taiwan has removed reference to Taiwan being part of China. The updated text calls Taiwan "a leading democracy". Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian said there's only one China, Taiwan belongs to China, and People's Republic of China is the sole legal government representing the whole country, further calling US' move "a petty act".

163.title: Centre ruined country's economy: Congress leader Sachin Pilot
163.article_body: After the Indian rupee fell to an all-time low of 77.42 against the US dollar on Monday, Congress leader Sachin Pilot said the Centre has ruined the country's economy. Pilot said, "The tenure of...Centre on the economic issues of...[India] is full of failures." Pilot said the BJP has put the country in economic crisis with inflation, unemployment and economic mismanagement.

164.title: Saddening to see no relief provided to post-poll victims: WB Guv
164.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday said that it's saddening that those who lost their properties after the post-poll violence in the state last year still haven't received compensation. "The memorandum demands financial compensation for all families whose properties got destructed. I will study this memorandum as administration should be unbiased," he added.

165.title: '83' made around ₹200 cr amid 3rd wave, which isn't bad: Ranveer Singh
165.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh revealed that his film '83' was criticised by the trade for not making as much money as it was projected to make. However, he added, "The film still made around ₹200 crore in the middle of the third wave which is not bad at all." "It was just a case of unfortunate timing," he added.

166.title: I stood up for Aishwarya when media fat-shamed her: Raveena
166.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon has recalled standing up for Aishwarya Rai saying she just had a baby when the media fat-shamed her. Raveena added, "A journalist said, 'Arrey Raveena ji, you have become so fat. You used to be 'mast cheez' and are now doing reality shows.' I told him, 'My fat will go away but how will your face change?'"

167.title: Bihar college principal, lecturers among 4 arrested for BPSC paper leak
167.article_body: Four people have been arrested in connection with the leak of the Bihar Public Service Commission's question papers for civil services (preliminary) examinations. The arrested persons include a principal of the college where the leak occurred, two lecturers and Barhara BDO Jai Vardhan Gupta. BPSC had cancelled the exam after the paper was leaked right before the exam on Sunday.

168.title: Andhra CM's cousin arrested in extortion case, CM says 'no one will be spared'
168.article_body: YSRCP leader and cousin of Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, YS Konda Reddy, was arrested on Tuesday in an alleged extortion case. The accused had allegedly demanded bribe from a construction company's owners for allowing them to continue their project in Chakrayapet Mandal. CM Reddy, while ordering a probe into the case, said no one will be spared.

169.title: Swiggy suspends Supr Daily operations in 5 cities including Delhi, Mumbai
169.article_body: Swiggy is suspending its subscription-based fresh groceries service Supr Daily's operations in five cities, namely Delhi-NCR, Mumbai, Pune, Hyderabad and Chennai. Swiggy will continue to serve its users in Bengaluru and "double down" on its efforts there. "We, unfortunately, are yet to demonstrate a clear path to profitability," Supr Daily CEO Phani Kishan Addepalli's e-mail to employees read.

170.title: 'Yellow brick road' found at the bottom of Pacific Ocean, footage released
170.article_body: A team of researchers discovered what looked like a yellow brick road at the bottom of the Pacific Ocean last month. Footage from the expedition showed the path which appeared to be paved with cobblestones and the researchers are heard describing it as "bizarre". One of the researchers is heard calling it "the road to Atlantis".

171.title: Never too old: Omar after ex-H'yana CM Chautala passes Class 10 &12 at 87
171.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM and NC leader Omar Abdullah on Tuesday praised former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala after the latter passed Class 10 and 12 at the age of 87 on Tuesday. "A person is never too old to learn. Congratulations Chautala (sahib)," Abdullah tweeted. Haryana Education Board officials handed over the marksheets to Chautala in Chandigarh today.

172.title: Dismiss Jairam Thakur govt over HP's deteriorating law & order: AAP to Guv
172.article_body: AAP on Tuesday asked Himachal Pradesh Governor RV Arlekar to dismiss the Jairam Thakur-led government over "deteriorating" law and order in Himachal Pradesh. Earlier, AAP held a demonstration outside the Shimla Deputy Commissioner's office for the same reason. This comes after Khalistani flags were tied to the main gate and boundary wall of the Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly.

173.title: Amit Shah inaugurates Assam govt's monthly newsletter 'Asom Barta'
173.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah inaugurated the Assam government's monthly newsletter 'Asom Barta' in Guwahati on Tuesday. "The newsletter will enable citizens to stay connected with the government and its policies," its editor Bishnu Kamal Bora said. It will be printed in Assamese, English, and Hindi initially and in Bengali and other regional languages of Assam later on, he added.

174.title: Karnataka IPS officer Ravindranath resigns for 4th time, cites 'harassment'
174.article_body: IPS officer P Ravindranath on Tuesday submitted his resignation from the police force for the fourth time in his career, citing "harassment". "I'm prematurely transferred without any public interest...since I've taken legal action against people involved in the fake caste certificate issue," he said in a letter. "I'm pained to observe the apathy shown by state Chief Secretary," Ravindranath added.

175.title: Checkpoints set up to stop Rajapaksa supporters from fleeing Sri Lanka
175.article_body: Anti-government protesters in Colombo have set up checkpoints on a road leading to city's airport in a bid to prevent supporters of ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa from leaving Sri Lanka amid the ongoing economic crisis.
