The firm has seen a drop in users clicking on links to news articles since former US President Donald Trump left office. Meta earlier said it was slowing the growth of its workforce.

350.title: Musk's $44 bn Twitter deal at risk of being repriced lower, warns short-seller
350.article_body: Elon Musk's $44 billion offer to buy Twitter could get repriced lower if he walked away from the deal, short-seller Hindenburg Research warned on Monday. "Musk holds all the cards here," Hindenburg, which has a short position on Twitter, said. "If Musk's bid for Twitter disappeared tomorrow, Twitter's equity would fall by 50% from current levels," it added.

351.title: Where's edit button?: Musk's mom after mistake in her tweet about Taj Mahal
351.article_body: Maye Musk, the mother of the world's richest man Elon Musk who is buying Twitter, took to Twitter to share a picture from her Taj Mahal visit. "I went to the Taj Mahal in 2007...It is beautiful," she tweeted, however, she later tweeted, "Not 2007, 2012. Where is that edit button?" Earlier, Twitter confirmed it's working on an edit button.

352.title: Important for Umran to stay away from distractions: VVS Laxman
352.article_body: Former India batter VVS Laxman has said that SRH pacer Umran Malik needs to continue maintaining his focus and importantly stay away from distractions. "Soon you realise that you have to control your actions (off the field). There will be so many advisors...but players...very soon cordon all that off and focus on what is to be done," Laxman said.

353.title: Some bats pretend to be bees to scare off predators: Research
353.article_body: While studying how mouse-eared bats deal with other animals, researchers observed they buzzed like hornets or bees, possibly, in an attempt to push back potential predators. When buzzing sounds were played on speakers, bat predators were seen moving away in contrast to speakers that played non-buzzing sounds. This is the first time a mammal was found mimicking an insect.

354.title: Allahabad HC denies bail to 4 accused in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri case
354.article_body: Allahabad High Court on Monday rejected bail pleas of four accused in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri case. "These accused belong to very influential political families...apprehension of the prosecution that they would interfere with the course of justice...cannot be ruled out at this stage," HC said. The court will hear Union Minister Ajay Mishra's son Ashish Mishra's bail plea on May 25.

355.title: FIFA asks Brazil, Argentina to play abandoned WC qualifier again
355.article_body: Argentina and Brazil have been asked by FIFA to replay their 2022 World Cup qualifier, which was abandoned due to the alleged breach of COVID-19 protocols by the Argentinian side in September 2021. Both teams have qualified for the World Cup in Qatar, with Brazil topping the South American zone qualifying standings and Argentina finishing second.

356.title: Lovlina Borgohain starts with a win at the World Boxing Championships
356.article_body: Indian boxer Lovlina Borgohain won her first bout at the 12th IBA Women's World Boxing Championships. The 24-year-old boxer defeated the Chinese Taipei boxer and former world champion, Chen Nien-Chin, by 3-2 in the 70kg category event. Notably, Borgohain will now meet England's Cindy Ngamba in the 'Round of 16' match on Friday.

357.title: AAP govt in Punjab harmful for state's security: Cong's Jaiveer
357.article_body: Following a blast at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali, Congress leader Jaiveer Shergill said the AAP government in Punjab is "harmful" for the state's security. "I urge Union Home Minister Amit Shah to engage central probe agencies in the matter as AAP government is not capable to handle, nor does it have the right intent," Shergill added.

358.title: Mumbai-based Skillmatics raises $16 mn in Series B led by Sofina
358.article_body: Mumbai-based D2C educational games and resource brand Skillmatics has raised $16 million in its latest funding round led by Sofina Ventures. The funding round also saw participation from existing investors Sequoia Capital India and Jalaj Dani Family Office. Founded by Dhvanil Sheth and Devanshi Kejriwal, Skillmatics designs content-led games and play centric learning resources.

359.title: Only way to experience independence is through education: NASA scientist
359.article_body: The only way to experience true independence and empowerment is through education, an Indian-origin Program Scientist at NASA, Dr Hashima Hasan, said. "Get an education, build your confidence and stand on your own feet," she said while addressing the 7th annual Tehrim Dass Memorial Lecture at the Avadh Girls’ Degree College (AGDC) Lucknow.

360.title: Show some sensitivity towards Kashmiri Pandits for Sunanda's sake: Anupam to Tharoor
360.article_body: After Shashi Tharoor tweeted that Singapore has banned 'The Kashmir Files', actor Anupam Kher tweeted, "Dear Shashi Tharoor! Your callousness towards Kashmiri Hindus' genocide is tragic." Kher added, "If nothing else at least for Sunanda's sake who was a Kashmiri herself, you should show some sensitivity towards Kashmiri Pandits and not feel victorious about a country banning The Kashmir Files!"

361.title: Police raid rave party in B'luru, seize drugs worth ₹3 lakh; 33 held
361.article_body: Bengaluru Police raided a rave party at Otto's gastropub on the Old Airport Road and detained 33 people, including two organisers for allegedly selling and consuming drugs on Sunday. They seized multiple drugs, including MDMA, ecstasy pills, charas and ganja worth around ₹3 lakh from the venue. The attendees reportedly included students, IT firm employees and businessmen among others.

362.title: School athletes mistakenly given sanitiser to drink during race in Japan
362.article_body: Authorities of a Japanese school mistakenly gave sanitisers in cups instead of water to athletes during a race. They accidentally used the sanitiser that was stored in an unlabelled plastic bottle next to drinking water. While one athlete collapsed, vomited and dropped out of the race, a total of three of them were taken to the hospital.

363.title: I was dropped for a couple of games, it's been a tough period: Venkatesh
363.article_body: KKR all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer said it has been a tough period for him having been dropped for a few games by the franchise. Venkatesh recently made a comeback in his team's win against MI by 52 runs. "I cannot control what happens out there...I can only control my process and that is what I have been doing," added Venkatesh.

364.title: Bulldozer used to help conduct raid, arrest rape accused: UP to SC
364.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government has submitted an affidavit to Supreme Court stating that a bulldozer was used to "help" conduct a raid on the house of two people accused of rape in Saharanpur and make arrests. The affidavit was in response to a petition over unlawful use of bulldozers on suspicion of crime. "Whatever action was taken...was necessary," the affidavit stated.

365.title: Deepika doesn't want same unpleasant path for me: Ranveer on work-life balance
365.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said his wife and actress Deepika Padukone shares the importance of a work-life balance with him, having realised the same herself. "Deepika...guides me because she has also been there. She doesn't want me to go down that same not so pleasant path," added Ranveer. "Deepika's the reason I am able to have this personal evolution," stated Ranveer.

366.title: Mizoram CM flags off inter-state 'Unity' bus service to Tripura
366.article_body: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga on Monday flagged off an inter-state bus service called 'Unity' from Aizawl to Behliangchhip town in Tripura. The bus would run from Aizawl every Monday and Thursday, and would return from Behliangchhip every Tuesday and Friday. According to officials, efforts are underway to launch transport services between Aizawl and Churachandpur in Manipur and Tahan in Myanmar.

367.title: 9 lakh Afghans lost their jobs since Taliban takeover: US body
367.article_body: At least 9 lakh Afghans lost their jobs since the Taliban came to power in Afghanistan following withdrawal of American forces, said US Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction (SIGAR). Women's participation in the workforce is expected to shrink by 21% by mid-2022, said a report. Notably, the Taliban recently mandated women to cover their bodies completely in public.

368.title: Very receptive and down to earth CM: Sidhu praises CM Bhagwant Mann
368.article_body: Calling his 50-minute meeting with Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann "very positive", Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Monday praised Mann, saying he is a "very down to earth CM". "I haven't met such a receptive CM. He was ready to listen," Sidhu said. Sidhu had earlier called Mann a "rubber doll", alleging his government was run by Delhi.

369.title: Won't tolerate delay in implementing budget programmes: Karnataka CM
369.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday warned government officials against any delay in budget implementation. "You're under my radar. My government will not tolerate any delay in implementing...budget programmes," Bommai said during a meeting of Chief Executive Officers of Zilla Panchayats. He further urged the officials to restore public faith in the government by implementing welfare schemes.

370.title: She doesn't need dad's approval: Sona on Aamir's daughter being trolled for bikini pics
370.article_body: Referring to Aamir Khan's daughter Ira getting trolled for being in bikini in front of his father on her birthday, singer Sona Mohapatra, who was present at Ira's birthday party, wrote on Instagram, "She's 25...A free thinking adult woman...Is exercising her choices." Sona added, "She doesn’t need her dad’s approval or yours...Buzz off...Shove your politics where the sun don't shine."

371.title: State-wise percentage of women who are able to refuse sex to husbands released by govt
371.article_body: Eighty-two per cent women in India can say no to their husband if they do not want to have sexual intercourse, according to government's National Family Health Survey 5. The percentage in Lakshadweep, Mizoram and Goa stands at 94.2%, 93.3% and 91.9% respectively. The percentage is the lowest in Ladakh at 60.9%, according to the government data.

372.title: Pak TV channels told not to air content against military, judiciary
372.article_body: The Pakistan Electronic Media Regulatory Authority (PEMRA) has warned TV channels to not air content which casts aspersions against the country's military and judiciary. "Airing such content violated PEMRA rules," it said, adding that the channels could face legal action in case of violation. This comes after the Pakistani military warned journalists against dragging it into political issues.

373.title: 10 flights cancelled at Chennai Airport amid rains, winds due to Cyclone Asani
373.article_body: At least 10 flights have been cancelled at Chennai Airport amid heavy rains and gusty winds due to Cyclone Asani. Chennai Airport Authority confirmed flights to Chennai from Hyderabad, Mumbai, Visakhapatnam and Jaipur have been cancelled. Meanwhile, IMD said severe cyclonic storm lay centred 300 km southeast of Kakinada and 330 km south-southeast of Visakhapatnam at 5.30 am on Tuesday.

374.title: BharatPe fires several employees, to claw back ex-founder's restricted shares
374.article_body: BharatPe on Tuesday said it has initiated an action to claw back restricted shares of its former founder following a governance review. Notably, in a statement, it added that a new code of conduct has been implemented in the company. BharatPe said that it has also terminated the services of several employees who were involved with blocked vendors.

375.title: UGC seeks report from Sharda University over exam question on Hindutva & fascism
375.article_body: The University Grants Commission has sought an action taken report from Sharda University, Greater Noida over an "objectionable" question asked by it in a Political Science examination on similarities between Hindutva and fascism. "Needless to say asking students such questions is against the spirit and ethos of our country which is known for its inclusivity and homogeneity," the UGC said.

376.title: Declare India as Hindu Rashtra, ban other religions: TMC’s Yashwant Sinha
376.article_body: TMC leader Yashwant Sinha on Monday said that a simple solution to all our problems today is to declare India as a "Hindu Rashtra" by amending the Constitution and banning all other religions. "Delete non-Hindu history, take revenge for past wrongs against Hindus by Buddhists, Jains, Muslims and Christians," Sinha added.

377.title: Supreme Court stays arrest of Noida CEO Ritu Maheshwari in contempt case
377.article_body: Supreme Court has stayed the arrest of Noida CEO and IAS officer Ritu Maheshwari in a contempt case. This comes after the Allahabad High Court issued a non-bailable warrant against her. The contempt plea was filed by two persons whose land was acquired in 1990 by the New Okhla Industrial Development Authority (NOIDA) but they were not given fair compensation.

378.title: Sony's Q4 operating profit more than doubles to $1.06 billion
378.article_body: Sony has reported that its fourth-quarter operating profit more than doubled to $1.06 billion, helped by strong performance in its gaming and network services business. Sony's profit for the three months to March 31 stood at $510 million a year earlier. For the current year, Sony forecast operating profit to fall to $8.8 billion from $9.2 billion.

379.title: Very tough for DC to make a comeback after their 91-run loss vs CSK: Kaif
379.article_body: Ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said it is "very difficult" for DC to make a comeback following their defeat against CSK by 91 runs. "Self-doubts creep in after such defeats. Fans will be really disappointed as they wouldn't have expected such an effort," added Kaif. "They are depending a lot on David Warner. It's...like when Warner scores, DC wins," stated Kaif.

380.title: Sports facilities, course for para athletes proposed at Mumbai University
380.article_body: Physical Education department of Mumbai University has submitted proposal to have sports facilities and curated course on fitness training for para athletes. Professor Dr Vasanthi Kadhiravan, head of department, said, "Sports...is...important aspect of lives of differently abled people...not only does it help them in keeping illnesses away...it...enhances motivation and sense of accomplishment."

381.title: Johnny Depp to star as French King Louis XV in Maiwenn's next film: Reports
381.article_body: Johnny Depp is set to feature as French King Louis XV in a film which will be directed by French actress-filmmaker Maiwenn, as per reports. Maiwenn, who'll also star in the film, will play a mistress of the king, Jeanne du Barry, who was beheaded during the French Revolution, according to Deadline. It'll reportedly go on floors on July 8.

382.title: Twitter will comply with EU content rules after takeover: Elon Musk
382.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Twitter will comply with European Union’s rules on content once his proposed takeover is completed. Musk met Thierry Breton, the EU’s Internal Market Commissioner on Monday for the same. The EU agreed on the Digital Services Act last month, which was aimed at urging technology platforms to better police their published content.

383.title: Wasn't happy with work I was doing, thought of quitting acting in 2019: Wamiqa
383.article_body: Wamiqa Gabbi, known for her performances in '83' and 'Mai', has said she was not happy with the kind of work she was doing earlier and even thought of quitting acting in 2019. She added that things have changed for her with shows like 'Grahan' and 'Mai'. "I'm glad that I'm working in the industry in this phase," Wamiqa said.

384.title: Look for traces of Lata ji's singing in every singer I introduce: Bhansali
384.article_body: Sanjay Leela Bhansali said he grew up "hero-worshipping" late singer Lata Mangeshkar, adding he looks for traces of her singing in every singer he introduces while composing music. "When I discover some rare song of hers, I feel...richer than a diamond merchant," Bhansali had earlier stated. Bhansali termed his recent film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' as his most exhausting movie so far.

385.title: UP government to set up office in Mumbai for its own natives
385.article_body: Uttar Pradesh (UP) government is planning to open an office in Maharashtra's Mumbai to connect with its own natives who're living in the latter state, according to a statement. The decision will help make migrants aware of the possible investments in UP, a government spokesperson said. It will also help people return to UP during any crisis, the spokesperson added.

386.title: Actress Demi Moore shares pic with 'hugging saint' Mata Amritanandamayi Devi
386.article_body: Actress Demi Moore took to social media to share a picture with her daughters and Mata Amritanandamayi Devi, who is known as the hugging saint. "Wow...amazing I had a blessing from this lady she came to Dublin in Ireland. She’s amazing," a fan commented. "Mata Amritanandamayi is your spiritual leader?" wrote another user.

387.title: Gujarat govt to provide ₹100 cr aid to onion farmers
387.article_body: Gujarat government will provide financial assistance of ₹100 crore to onion farmers in the state, Agriculture Minister Raghavji Patel said on Monday. "One farmer can get an assistance of a maximum of 25,000 kilograms...it's an assistance of ₹50,000 per farmer," Patel said. "The...farmers had made representations...about the losses incurred due to the low selling prices of onion," he added.

388.title: Pune to get light rain on Tuesday and Wednesday: IMD
388.article_body: Pune is likely to witness some light intensity rainfall on Tuesday and Wednesday, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted. "There is moisture incursion from easterly winds...Partly cloudy sky conditions will develop from time to time, keeping the maximum temperatures slightly below normal over many areas in Maharashtra, including Pune and surrounding areas," an IMD official said.

389.title: Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma passes away aged 84
389.article_body: Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma has passed away due to cardiac arrest at the age of 84 in Mumbai. He had been suffering from kidney-related issues for the last six months and was on dialysis. He composed music with flute legend Pandit Hariprasad Chaurasia for films such as Silsila, Lamhe and Chandni among others.

390.title: Former dictator's son Ferdinand Marcos Jr wins Philippine Presidential elections
390.article_body: Ferdinand Marcos Jr, son of former Philippines' dictator Ferdinand Marcos has won Philippine Presidential elections with 96% of the eligible ballots counted in an unofficial tally. Marcos Jr has more than 30 million votes, double that of his rival Leni Robredo. Marcos fled into exile in Hawaii with his family during a 1986 uprising that ended his father's 20-year rule.

391.title: Who is 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz, who defeated Nadal and Djokovic in same tournament?
391.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz, who defeated Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal and Alexander Zverev en route to his Madrid Open victory, was born in El Palmar in Spain on May 5, 2003. He's now the world number six men's tennis player. He turned pro in 2018 and has won five singles titles. He's the second-youngest player to win two ATP Masters 1000 titles.

392.title: Unable to celebrate 2-yr-old son's b'day, 35-yr-old B'luru woman kills self
392.article_body: A 35-year-old woman died by suicide in Bengaluru after she was allegedly unable to celebrate her two-year-old son's birthday. Reports said that she was already stressed about the financial condition of the family. Her husband, who was forced to shut down his business after losses, had asked the woman to hold off the celebration plans.

393.title: Rajasthan Royals becomes a Green Yodha: Schneider Electric
393.article_body: Energy automation company, Schneider Electric partners with Rajasthan Royals as their official sustainability partner. The collaboration aims to make cricket a sustainable sport. The team will play the IPL 2022 season's first carbon-neutral cricket match on May 11 as part of the Green Yodha sustainability initiative.

394.title: Punjab and Haryana HC stays BJP's Tajinder Singh Bagga's arrest till July 5
394.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court on Tuesday stayed the arrest of BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga till July 5. He was arrested by Punjab Police on Friday over his alleged threat to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Bagga was released from Punjab Police's custody and brought back to Delhi, following which a Mohali court had issued fresh warrants against him.

395.title: Tinder-owner sues Google to stop its app from exiting Play Store
395.article_body: Tinder-owner Match Group has sued Google on Monday, calling the action a "last resort" to prevent Tinder and its other apps from being removed from the Play Store for refusing to share up to 30% of their sales. "Like any business, we charge for our services, and like any responsible platform, we protect users against fraud," Google said.

396.title: Some suspects taken into custody: Police to Punjab CM Mann on Mohali blast
396.article_body: Punjab Police DGP Viresh Kumar Bhawra told Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann that some suspects in Mohali blast case have been taken into custody. CM Mann had earlier said that a probe was underway and that culprits will not be spared. Meanwhile, Punjab was put on high alert after the blast took place at the Police Intelligence headquarters on Monday.

397.title: GST inspector arrested while taking ₹2 lakh bribe in Gurugram
397.article_body: The Haryana State Vigilance Bureau on Monday arrested a GST inspector in Gurugram while accepting a bribe of ₹2 lakh. The officer had allegedly demanded a sum of ₹7 lakh from a building material supplier for issuing a GST number. Based on the supplier's complaint, a team of the vigilance bureau laid a trap and arrested the officer red-handed.

398.title: 284 geo-tagged CCTVs installed across Rachakonda Commissionerate
398.article_body: About 284 more geo-tagged CCTVs have been installed across Rachakonda Police Commissionerate in Hyderabad. The cameras, sponsored by the Telangana State Industrial Infrastructure Corporation (TSIIC), have been set up at main roads, below poverty line (BPL) colonies and other crime prone areas. The TSIIC had granted an amount of ₹3 crore for the installation of the cameras.

399.title: Demolition drive underway at Delhi's New Friends Colony, Mangolpuri; AAP MLA detained
399.article_body: An anti-encroachment drive to remove illegal structures is currently underway in Delhi's New Friends Colony and Mangolpuri amid heavy security arrangements, reported ANI. AAP MLA Mukesh Ahlawat reached Mangolpuri area and said they first need to prove that there is encroachment and bulldozers must be stooped. Ahlawat was detained by police, informed DCP, Outer District, Delhi Police Sameer Sharma.

400.title: We had our chance: Bumrah after loss to KKR by 52 runs
400.article_body: After registering his best-ever T20 figures against KKR on Monday, Mumbai Indians pacer Jasprit Bumrah has said that they had their "chance" after losing the game by 52 runs. "Always a good feeling to contribute but the important thing is for the team to win. We had our chance to do that but couldn't get it done," Bumrah said.

401.title: 18-yr-old woman kidnapped, raped while distributing her wedding cards in UP
401.article_body: An 18-year-old woman has alleged that she was kidnapped and raped by three men while she was distributing her wedding invitation cards in Uttar Pradesh. She also alleged that the accused took her to a political party leader, with whom she stayed for a few days before they forced her to stay with someone else in their village.
